question: Which Indian boxer has been elected as a member of the first-ever international boxing body (AIBA) athletes' commission?
explanation: Indian boxer, Laishram Sarita Devi of Manipur has been elected unopposed as a member of the first-ever international boxing body (AIBA) athletes\' commission. She was inspired by Muhammad Ali\'s achievements, and turned professional in boxing in the year 2000. She is DSP in Manipur Police. The election of the Athletes Commission members was organized during AIBA Men and Women World Boxing Championships 2019 in Russia. Boxers from all over the world voted for new members - one per continent, except Europe which has two representatives.
